span.style: font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; color: #212121; font-size: 20px

strong.span: Welcome to Sacaton Elementary School District, Home of the Braves - YES!

div.span: Dear SESD Families,

I am extremely appreciative of our students, parents, teachers, staff, and administrators for the positivity, flexibility, and resilience during these trying times. As you know, Sacaton Elementary School District is currently closed and will remain so throughout the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year due to the COVID-19 pandemic. However, our distance learning opportunities are in full motion. Our goal is to provide continuous educational opportunities and practice for students while schools are closed and to eliminate as much stress as possible for students, parents, and teachers. While it is our responsibility to continue to educate our children, we want to compassionately take into consideration the variety of difficulties that our families and employees are enduring at this time.
We will continue to support students, families and the community throughout the remainder of the school year, in the following ways:

Continuity of Education: Preschool – 8th grade teachers are providing learning opportunities through Google Classrooms and learning packets designed to meet the needs of learners. Additionally, further support is provided to students with additional student needs. Online Learning provides student access to instructional resources such as teacher-recorded YouTube videos, links to district adopted curricula and daily Zoom chats supports provided over the phone. All students have the opportunity to sign out a Chromebook or i-Pad and to date, we have checked-out over 400 devices. While the majority of the resources are supported through online access, some websites provide for offline use once the resource is downloaded so students who do not have access to the internet can still benefit from using a Chromebook or iPad. Learning packets are available to support those students unable to access technology and can be picked up every Wednesday. Ensuring our students stay connected and continue their learning path is our priority.

Meal Distribution: Our meal program is providing nutrition to students (up to the age of 18). Each morning our busses depart on delivery routes or families have the option to use our curbside meal service. Since the closure, we have delivered over 10,000 meals and will continue to do so until the end of the school year. During the summer months, our program will adapt accordingly.

We hope to welcome you back to the 2020-2021 school year on August 6. Registration packets were mailed out to all students on Friday, April 17. We are asking families to return the completed information as soon as possible so that we can build the classes to begin in the fall.
Please contact your child’s teacher or administrators if you or your child need support.
We miss you. Stay strong, stay healthy.
Sincerely,
Dr. Cherryl Paul
Superintendent
